items.title: Boulter misses out on Australian Open main draw
items.summary: Former British number one Katie Boulter will have to go through qualifying in January to secure a place at the Australian Open.

items.title: Under-pressure Alonso feels 'unity' at Real Madrid
items.summary: Real Madrid have a collective desire to end their poor run of form, says coach Xabi Alonso, who has not ruled out a return to work in the Premier League.

items.title: RAM is ruining everything
items.summary: Memory suppliers just blew a hole in the PC gaming industry - and they're about to do the same to everything else. For weeks, PC enthusiasts have borne the brunt of skyrocketing memory prices, but the shockwaves will soon impact a wider range of products as suppliers pour resources into a far biggeâ€¦

items.title: Chinese vendor unveils 256GB of RAM that costs more than an MSRP RTX 5090 â€” Asgard's DDR5-6000 retails at an eye-watering $2,400, but is more affordable than some mainstream alternatives
items.summary: Chinese memory vendor Asgard launches 256GB and 192GB DDR5 memory kits for $1,200 and $2,400, respectively.

items.title: England and Spurs' Naz out for season with ACL injury
items.summary: England and Tottenham forward Jess Naz has suffered an anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury and will miss the rest of the season.

items.title: Scavenger scores 14900KS PC with 64GB of DDR5 for less than the cost of RAM alone â€” $2500+ machine sells for just $600
items.summary: A pawn shop in Portugal clearly didn't know the worth of what they had and ended up selling a high-end PC worth at least $2,500 with current market pricing, for just $600 to a lucky buyer. The PC includes flagship components, including two 32 GB sticks of 6000 MT/s DDR5 memory that alone costs almoâ€¦

items.title: Oppo A6L debuts in China with familiar looks and specs
items.summary: Oppo launched a new midranger in China and it brings a familiar set of looks and specs to a few other models from the brand. The Oppo A6L is a rebrand of the Oppo A6 Max, which launched back in August in China. As such it brings the same core specs, including a massive 7,000 mAh Si/C battery, a 6.8â€¦
